intro: Cerastium mutabile var. triviale, commonly known as the common mouse-ear chickweed, is a low-growing perennial plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It features small, ovate leaves that are hairy and clustered at the base of the stems. The plant produces clusters of white, star-shaped flowers during the spring and early summer. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Cerastium mutabile var. triviale is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks.
